author: Andrew Greif
description: The new pope's Chicago roots led to speculation whether he held any rooting interests in the city's teams. The answer isn't straightforward.
title: Sorry, Cubs fans: Pope Leo roots for the White Sox, his brother says

author: Henry J. Gomez
description: The former Ohio State football coach made the announcement as the Ohio Republican Party considers endorsing Trump-backed Vivek Ramaswamy in the May 2026 primary.
title: Ohio Lt. Gov. Jim Tressel confirms he's considering a run for governor

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Migrants from Asia and Mexico were woken up at 2:30 a.m. and boarded on a bus to wait outside a military plane for hours. They were then sent back to solitary confinement.
title: Why Asian and Mexican immigrants, moments away from being deported to Libya, never left the U.S.

author: Sahil Kapur
description: Their stance further complicates the task for House GOP leaders as they try to advance a massive bill for Trump's agenda through the tax-writing committee.
title: Key New York Republicans reject 'insulting' offer on 'SALT' tax break

author: Rosie Colosi, TODAY
description: Together with her basketball-star husband, Dwyane Wade, Gabrielle Union, welcomed daughter Kaavia James via surrogate in November 2018 when Union was 46 and Wade was 36.
title: Gabrielle Union gets brutally honest about surrogacy: 'I'll never have peace with it, ever'

author: Scott Stump, TODAY
description: “The Real Housewives of Orange County” alum Lydia McLaughlin shared a tribute to her brother amid his funeral and the release of bodycam footage from the traffic stop in April where he was fatally shot by police.
title: Police release fatal traffic stop footage involving brother of 'RHOC' alum Lydia McLaughlin

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Being the children of one of the most iconic supermodels in history doesn’t faze Cindy Crawford’s kids.
title: Cindy Crawford's kids open up in rare interview about following in mom's footsteps

author: Chrissy Callahan, TODAY
description: After months of decoding clues, fans of “The Masked Singer” finally know the identities of the final four contestants.
title: Pearl won 'The Masked Singer' — and her identity makes the judges' jaws drop

author: The Politics Desk
description: Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost became the first-ever pope born in the United States. So naturally, domestic politics quickly intervened.
title: When the pope and politics collide: From the Politics Desk

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: President Donald Trump will announce a plan to lower U.S. prescription drug costs by tying the amount the government pays for some medications to prices paid abroad.
title: Trump's drug price plan expected to push drugmakers to charge same as other countries

author: Alexander Smith
description: From priests on pogos celebrating in St. Peter’s Square to the crowd outside St. Patrick’s in New York, the overwhelming emotions were shock, joy, and hope.
title: Catholic Americans rejoice for Pope Leo XIV

author: Ben Goggin
description: The top U.S. watchdog monitoring child exploitation online says that a sharp drop in reports from tech companies is primarily due to Meta and its embrace of end-to-end encryption.
title: Child exploitation watchdog says Meta encryption led to sharp decrease in tips and reports

author: Greg Iacurci, CNBC
description: These days, job hunting may feel like something of a paradox: Even though the overall market is strong, it can be tough for jobseekers to find a new gig, according to economists.
title: How to land a new job in a 'low firing, low hiring' market, economist says

author: MacKenzie Sigalos, CNBC
description: Alexander Mashinsky, the former CEO of Celsius Network, was sentenced to 12 years in prison on Thursday after pleading guilty to two counts of fraud, a dramatic fall for the leader of a company once hailed as the “bank” of the crypto industry.
title: Celsius CEO Alex Mashinsky sentenced to 12 years in multibillion-dollar crypto fraud case

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: DETROIT — Carvana’s first-quarter results easily topped Wall Street’s expectations as the company reported record sales driven by higher-than-expected industry demand amid fears of price increases due to automotive tariffs.
title: Carvana's record quarterly results top Wall Street expectations

description: Cameron Hamilton's removal comes one day after he testified at a congressional hearing that he did not believe FEMA should be eliminated, something Trump said he is considering.
title: Trump's acting FEMA head fired

author: Rob Wile
description: Stablecoins have come into focus on Thursday, as Democrats opposed legislation aimed at creating a legal pathway for the digital tokens.
title: Stablecoins are back in focus as Senate Democrats reject legislation approving their use

author: Melanie Zanona
description: Trump privately pressed Johnson to increase the tax rate on the highest earners and close the so-called carried interest loophole.
title: Trump urges Speaker Mike Johnson to raise taxes on the wealthy, adding new wrinkle to massive GOP bill

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: The National Queer Theater's Criminal Queerness Festival has turned to online fundraising after the National Endowment for the Arts revoked its $20,000 grant.
title: Federal agency axes LGBTQ festival's funding, says it 'does not align' with Trump's priorities

author: Yamiche Alcindor
description: Trump announced Thursday that he would be replacing Ed Martin, a "stop the steal" organizer closely aligned with Jan. 6 defendants, as his nominee for the post.
title: Trump weighs naming Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as D.C.'s top federal prosecutor

author: Shannon Pettypiece
description: Luxury British carmakers like Rolls-Royce, Range Rover and Aston Martin will be getting a tariff reprieve under the outlines of a trade agreement President Donald Trump announced Thursday while doubling down on his threats to continue tariffs on toys.
title: Trump gives break to Rolls-Royce cars, but threatens more tariffs on Mattel toys

author: NBC Los Angeles
description: Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum and SoFi Stadium will host the Opening and Closing Ceremony for the 2028 Olympics, it was announced Thursday.
title: 2028 Los Angeles Olympics Opening and Closing Ceremony locations revealed

description: Pope Leo XIV, formerly Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost, was appointed by Pope Francis in 2023. Leo is the first American pope in history and was born in Chicago.
title: Who is Pope Leo XIV? Examining Robert Francis Prevost's background

author: Alexander Smith
description: Groups of funs rom all corners of the world have come here to witness the election of the next pope.
title: In photos: Nuns from across the world gather on Vatican streets to witness history

description: President Donald Trump congratulated Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost on his being named Pope Leo XIV.
title: Trump calls American pope 'a Great Honor for our Country'

author: Viola Flowers
description: Kavan Markwood, the fan who fell 20 feet onto the home field of the Pittsburgh Pirates on April 30, spoke publicly for the first time to the Pittsburgh Tribune-Review on Wednesday.
title: Pittsburgh Pirates fan who fell at game speaks out, says he's 'broken everything'

author: Katherine Koretski
description: Kaja Sokola, a former runway model from Poland who accused disgraced movie mogul Harvey Weinstein of sexual assault in a lawsuit, tearfully described the alleged encounter as the most “horrifying thing I ever experienced” during testimony at Weinstein’s sexual abuse retrial on Thursday.
title: 'I was scared of him': Harvey Weinstein accuser testifies about 'horrifying' encounter with former movie mogul

author: Denise Chow
description: A recent study found increased seismicity and swelling at Axial Seamount, suggesting an eruption could occur sometime this year.
title: An underwater volcano off the coast of Oregon may be about to erupt

author: Tanaya Macheel, CNBC
description: Bitcoin on Thursday hit its highest level since February, climbing back above the key $100,000 level.
title: Bitcoin jumps above $100,000 for first time since February

author: Amelia Lucas, CNBC
description: Krispy Kreme stock plunged 24% on Thursday morning after the doughnut chain said it is “reassessing” its rollout with McDonald’s and pulled its full-year outlook in part due to economic “softness.”
title: Krispy Kreme stock plunges after doughnut chain pauses McDonald's rollout, pulls outlook

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Trump administration asked the Supreme Court to allow it to revoke temporary legal status to more than 500,000 immigrants that had been granted it by the Biden administration.
title: Trump asks Supreme Court to revoke legal status of 500,000 immigrants

author: David K. Li
description: The FAA will embark on an ambitious three-year plan to modernize America's air traffic control systems and phase out the "outdated technologies that are unable to meet" modern demands, officials said Thursday.
title: FAA announces new air traffic control system in hopes of taming busy skies

author: Linda Carroll
description: In a new survey, women with pelvic disorders reported doctors made dismissive comments and they were told to lose weight, get therapy or drink alcohol to cope with pain.
title: Doctors often gaslight women with pelvic disorders and pain, study finds

author: The Associated Press
description: Researchers found that the egg’s equator was more flexible and absorbed more of the energy of a fall before cracking.
title: Eggs are less likely to crack when dropped on their side, according to science

description: Cardinal Robert Prevost has been named as the new pope after being elected by the conclave. He is the first American to be the leader of the Catholic Church.
title: American Cardinal Robert Prevost is named as new pope

author: Courtney Kube
description: President Donald Trump’s fight against the Houthis never dealt a crippling blow to the militant group, but it has cost America more than $1 billion since March.
title: Trump operation against Houthis cost more than $1 billion

author: Natasha Korecki
description: Former President Joe Biden denied he suffered cognitive decline while in White House, saying allegations trickling out since he departed were off base.
title: Biden denies cognitive decline in office

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he would replace Ed Martin as his nominee for U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia.
title: Trump says he'll replace loyalist Ed Martin as his nominee to be D.C.'s top prosecutor

author: Alexander Smith
description: VATICAN CITY — Habemus Papam!
title: Vatican conclave chooses new pope

author: Aria Bendix
description: The Trump administration terminated $1.81 billion in National Institutes of Health grants in less than 40 days, including $544 million in as-yet-unspent funds.
title: Trump administration cut more than $1.8 billion in NIH grants

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: The Republican-led Senate is moving forward with a vote Thursday on a bipartisan crypto regulation bill, but it’s unclear if enough Democrats will support it as negotiations between the two parties are ongoing.
title: Senate expected to forge ahead with vote to advance crypto bill with bipartisan talks ongoing

author: Viola Flowers
description: Brad Arnold, lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, has been diagnosed with stage four cancer and is cancelling the band's upcoming tour, he announced in an Instagram post on Wednesday.
title: 3 Doors Down singer Brad Arnold says he has stage 4 cancer, cancels summer tour

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Bill Gates accused Elon Musk of killing poor children as he announced Thursday that he would donate his remaining fortune to his charity, the Gates Foundation.
title: Bill Gates accuses Musk of killing poor children by cutting foreign aid, and says he's giving away his wealth

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A mistrial was declared Thursday in the trial of a former Grand Rapids police officer in the 2022 shooting of Patrick Lyoya, who was fatally shot following a traffic stop.
title: Mistrial declared for former Michigan police officer in death of Black man shot in traffic stop

author: The Associated Press
description: Wildfires driven by climate change contribute to as many as thousands of annual deaths and billions of dollars in economic costs from wildfire smoke in the United States, according to a new study.
title: Smoke from climate-fueled wildfires contributed to thousands of U.S. deaths, study says

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A 17-year-old Texas high school senior is hospitalized with critical injuries after he fell from the back of a Jeep while playing the game “Senior Assassin,” his mother said.
title: Texas high school senior critically injured while playing 'Senior Assassin' game, mother says

author: The Associated Press
description: The Oklahoma City Thunder set an NBA playoff record for first-half points with 87 against the Denver Nuggets in Game 2 of their Western Conference semifinal series Wednesday night.
title: Thunder set NBA playoff record as they demolish the Nuggets to even series

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Fears of famine in the Gaza Strip grew Thursday as a major aid group said it had run out of food amid Israeli strikes that killed at least 100 people.
title: Israeli strikes kill at least 100 in Gaza as status of 3 living hostages remains 'uncertain'

description: Watch live coverage as President Donald Trump holds an Oval Office news conference to announce a trade deal with the United Kingdom, the first agreement since he imposed sweeping tariffs on U.S. trading partners.
title: Trump announces first post-tariff trade deal with Britain

author: Kimmy Yam
description: WNBA legend Sue Bird has been named managing director of the USA Women’s National Team, the program announced Thursday.
title: Sue Bird named first managing director of USA Women's National Team

author: Matt Lavietes
description: A group of investors sued UnitedHealthcare Group on Wednesday, accusing the company of misleading them after the killing of its CEO, Brian Thompson.
title: UnitedHealthcare sued by shareholders over reaction to CEO's killing

author: Shane Bishop
description: Previously unseen footage obtained by “Dateline” offers another angle into the Idaho student murders.
title: New video shows car resembling Bryan Kohberger's driving around the time of Idaho student murders

description: As air traffic controllers manage thousands of daily flights nationwide, they’re dealing with decades-old technology and significant staffing shortfalls. To address these challenges, the Department of Transportation is set to announce a multibillion-dollar plan to modernize the country’s air traffic control infrastructure. NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY.
title: DOT to overhaul nation's aging air traffic control system

description: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters have been taken into custody by police after they stormed a library at Columbia University in New York City. According to the school, a significant portion of the demonstrators have no affiliation with the university. Secretary of State Marco Rubio responded to the incident saying in a statement the administration is “reviewing the visa status of the trespassers and vandals.” NBC’s Sam Brock reports for TODAY.
title: Pro-Palestinian protesters arrested at Columbia University

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: Pakistan’s military has vowed that India will “pay dearly” after its airstrikes on Wednesday left at least 31 people dead in Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir, raising fears of an all-out war between the nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: After deadly cross-border strikes, can India and Pakistan avoid all-out war?

description: President Donald Trump says the United States has reached a “full and comprehensive agreement with the United Kingdom.” It comes as trade talks between the U.S. and China are set to take place, with Trump saying he would not consider lowering the massive 145% tariffs on China in order to get them to the negotiating table. Meanwhile, the White House is also facing a stark new warning about the possible long-term effects of the tariffs from the Federal Reserve. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports fo
title: Ahead of key talks, Trump says he won't soften on China tariffs

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Donald Trump will announce a new trade deal with the UK this morning.
title: Trump trade deal rhetoric and protesters arrested at Columbia University: Morning Rundown

description: Black smoke emerged from the chimney atop the Sistine Chapel on Thursday after the morning voting session, indicating the 133 cardinals remain undecided on who to select as the leader of the Catholic Church in the second day of voting. NBC’s Lester Holt reports for TODAY.
title: Conclave Thursday May 8: Black smoke rises after morning votes

author: Phil Helsel
description: An attorney for Smokey Robinson on Wednesday called accusations of sexual assault against the Motown legend false and said that the “You’ve Really Got a Hold on Me” singer will respond in the coming days.
title: Smokey Robinson denies claims of sexual assault, attorney says

author: Melissa Chan
description: Days after an equipment malfunction left planes flying blind over Newark airport, worried pilots and air traffic controllers are imploring the FAA to fix aging infrastructure.
title: Air traffic controllers work in constant fear, say outages have become too frequent

author: Nnamdi Egwuonwu
description: The legislation would make Trump's renaming of the Gulf of Mexico law and require federal agencies to update government documents accordingly.
title: House to vote on bill to codify Trump's Gulf of America executive order

author: Evan Bush
description: The historic rain and flooding in parts of Arkansas, Kentucky and other states caused by intense April thunderstorms was likelier and also more intense because of climate change.
title: Climate change made April flooding worse, study says

author: Zoë Richards
description: President Donald Trump said he is to sign a trade deal with Britain that will be America's first since he announced sweeping global tariffs.
title: Trump confirms he will sign first post-tariff trade deal with Britain

author: Jonathan Lloyd, NBC Los Angeles
description: Former Los Angeles Lakers player and coach Byron Scott is accused in a lawsuit amended earlier this month of sexually assaulting a girl in 1987 when she was 15 and he was 26 during a team event at her high school.
title: Ex-Lakers player and coach Byron Scott accused in lawsuit of sexually assaulting teen in 1987

author: Matt Dixon
description: As Marco Rubio ascends in Trump’s administration, those close to him and JD Vance downplay any talk of a clash between the two men.
title: Trump elevates Marco Rubio as a potential successor — and as a 2028 rival to Vance

author: Pilar Melendez
description: In a recent episode of his highly influential podcast, Joe Rogan declared what he sees as the latest triumph in the cultural battle over language: the return of the “R-word.”
title: The 'R-word,' embraced by Joe Rogan and Elon Musk, inches back into the mainstream

author: Shannon Pettypiece
description: After Donald Trump was elected president, Craig Souser was preparing for a surge in business for his Pennsylvania-based manufacturing company, which makes robotics systems used in food packaging.
title: How Trump's tariffs are causing pain for some U.S. manufacturers

author: The Associated Press
description: SANTA ANA, Calif.
title: 1 student killed and 2 wounded in stabbing outside Southern California high school

author: NBC San Diego
description: More than one year later, the official investigation into the cause of the military helicopter crash that killed five Marines is complete.
title: Deadly Marine helicopter crash in San Diego’s East County deemed ‘pilot error’

author: Mike Gavin, NBC New York
description: After an Ohio woman was placed under arrest during a traffic stop, an officer returned to the vehicle to find the driver’s seat occupied by a pet raccoon with a glass methamphetamine pipe in its mouth, police said.
title: Ohio police find raccoon holding meth pipe during traffic stop

author: The Associated Press
description: Mikal Bridges sealed another 20-point comeback with his second straight game-ending steal and the Knicks stunned the Celtics again Wednesday night.
title: Knicks take a 2-0 lead over the Celtics after coming from 20 down again

author: The Associated Press
description: Bryan Kohberger’s immediate family members may attend his upcoming quadruple-murder trial in the stabbing deaths of four University of Idaho students, even if they might be called to testify, a judge ruled in an order made public Thursday.
title: Kohberger's family may attend his trial in Idaho killings, judge rules

author: Andrew Blankstein
description: The man accused of crashing a car into the gate outside Jennifer Aniston's home has been charged with felony stalking and vandalism, the Los Angeles County District Attorney's office said Wednesday.
title: Man accused of crashing into Jennifer Aniston's gate charged with stalking and vandalism

author: The Associated Press
description: Federal officials on Wednesday released images of a doomed New York City sightseeing helicopter as it broke apart in midair last month, killing six people.
title: New report shows helicopter breaking apart in midair before crash that killed 6 in New York

author: Tim Stelloh
description: An Ohio man has been charged in the decades-old murder of a California woman after authorities linked him to a fingerprint found on a cigarette pack in the victim’s Volkswagen Beetle, officials said.
title: A fingerprint found on a cigarette pack helped solve a 50-year-old cold case in California
